ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Oven located...
ygData.msgSnippet: ... This has been confirmed by one of my friends. ... The book is called the Book of Rings.  He also drops a shoulder piece.  Both I believe are druid quest
ygData.messageBody:
>There IS an oven in the Temple of Droga
>in a goblin building waaay in the back in a section of the dungeon that is
>hidden behind a secret wall. I opened it and it is a standard six-slot
>oven.

This has been confirmed by one of my friends.

>In addition to the oven, when I was there one of the guards standing
>directly to the right of the door leading into the space where the oven is
>had a BOOK. He was the "goblin fanatic".

The book is called the Book of Rings. He also drops a shoulder piece. Both
I believe are druid quest items.

>One interesting sidebar is that the Jail has a Pottery Wheel in a jail cell
>behind a locked door. Now this is probably for another quest or something,
>but it raises the remote possibility in my mind that we might have to make
a
>Bundt Cake Pan.

This pottery wheel I've also seen second hand.

>Mini-Spoiler:
>When I was there (alone and invis) nothing attacked me and I had free run
of
>the place. I don't recall seeing any mobs other than goblins except for a
>couple of Iksar prisoners in a jail (i.e. no lone Burynai Prisoner or
>something that might drop some Burynai Meat). Word of advice: I fell into
>the pit trap located on the map pointed to in this thread. You fall into a
>jail cell and into a locked room. Presumably if you kill the three goblins
>in this room one or more will drop a key for you. I didn't find out
because
>after I memmed some songs and was working up the courage to Lament the
first
>couple the wandering goblin was kind enough to open the locked doors for
me,
>so I scooted out invis and didn't have to fight. :-)

Within the jail is a 'goblin penmaster' who drops a key and a necklace.
When id'd, the necklace is called Droga Primary Pen, and the key is Droga
Secondary Pen. I'm assuming these are keys to the jail. I didn't get to
try them out however. I had good experience with invis up until we reached
the stone bridge/entrance to the jail area. It seemed that everything back
there saw through my invis and a 49 druid's camo. We didn't walk up and
wave at them though, we con'd them from afar.

Woohoo! progress!! =)

PS I finally got a Selo's drum...yay for patch day! =)

Robynn Merrilin
Bard at Large on E'ci
Currently: Level 42 *ding*

--
Katy Westerman Don't lick something unless
katyw@... you really mean it.
